column4: I think "loads basic services" is misleading, recovery mode is what is also referred to as single user mode aka run level 1, basically no services are loaded
if you drop the stderr redirection you'll see you're getting an error from find
Thank you very much for your help. --  I wish you a happy new year 2009.
web safe colors... no one too much worries about them anymore btw, hardly anyone is still running 8-bit color
Thank you for anwering. I agree that this only a problem for some special equipment.
if you install linux-source then you do not need linux-doc... linux-source has the documentation in it's normal place, and linux-doc has it in /usr/doc for people who don't need the source
so the solutio is aptitude remove linux-doc ;)
I did not understand your sentence: "for people who don't need the source." Please elaborate.
if you don't need the kernel source, and just want to read the docs
Ok. --  You say: "linux-source has the documentation in it's normal place." What is its normal place?
I should have said it's in the kernel tarball along with the source
Ok. Thank you very much for your help.
what do you mean it complains at i? you get nothing back from fi<tab><tab> ?
complains means that it does not echo the i but makes an objecting sound.
